title39 = King Washington (Alternate Version) | note39 = | length39 = 3:37 | title40 = King Washington (Revisited Version) | note40 = | length40 = 1:48 }} ==Marketing== [[File:AC3 AU limited edition.jpg|thumb|right|Ubisoft Australia put together a "very special, very limited" edition of ''Assassin's Creed III'' to auction off in benefit of the Sydney Children's Hospital Foundation. There are only ten of these editions in the world, and eight of them were auctioned off to raise money for the Sydney Children's Hospital in Randwick.]] Ubisoft's senior vice president of sales and marketing, Tony Key, said the game would enjoy the biggest marketing commitment in company history. Ubisoft UK MD Rob Cooper has said that ''Assassin's Creed III'' is a good entry point for newcomers to the series, and that he thinks ''Assassin's Creed III'' will hold its own against this year's biggest releases.{{cite web|author=CVG Staff |url=http://www.computerandvideogames.com/339238/assassins-creed-3-a-great-time-for-gamers-to-join-the-adventure/ |title=News: Assassin's Creed 3 'a great time for gamers to join the adventure' |publisher=''[[Computer and Video Games]]'' |date=March 8, 2012 |accessdate=April 7, 2012}} In March 2012, the ''Assassin's Creed: Double Pack'' was released both as a retail purchase for PlayStation 3, Xbox 360 and for download on [[PlayStation Network|PSN]], which brings together the first ''[[Assassin's Creed (video game)|Assassin's Creed]]'' and ''[[Assassin's Creed II]]'' in a virtual compilation box.{{cite web |url=http://playstationedge.com/ps3/more-details-revealed-for-the-ubisoft-double-packs-on-ps3-xbox-360/ |archive-url=https://archive.is/20120713061219/http://playstationedge.com/ps3/more-details-revealed-for-the-ubisoft-double-packs-on-ps3-xbox-360/ |dead-url=yes |archive-date=July 13, 2012 |title=More Details Revealed For The Ubisoft Double Packs on PS3 & Xbox 360 |publisher=PlayStation Edge |date=January 14, 2012 |accessdate=May 8, 2012 }}{{cite web|last=Phillips |first=Tom |url=http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2012-03-21-assassins-creed-double-edition-rayman-3-hd-on-eu-playstation-store |title=Assassin's Creed Double Edition on EU PlayStation Store |publisher=[[Eurogamer]] |date=March 21, 2012 |accessdate=April 7, 2012}} Ubisoft has collaborated with several retail outlets on pre-order bonuses available through several store chains throughout the world. Which of the pre-order bonuses the player received depended upon where they pre-ordered the game. A free SteelBook collectible featuring artwork by renowned comic book artist [[Alex Ross]] is available as a pre-order incentive.{{Citation needed|date=May 2016}} The "Captain of the Aquila" DLC pack includes a single player weapon (The ''Pirate Boarding Axe'') and a single player skin (''The Captain of the Aquila's uniform'').{{Citation needed|date=May 2016}} The "Colonial Assassin" DLC pack includes a single player weapon (The ''Scottish Flintlock'') and a single player skin (the ''Traditional Colonial Assassins outfit'').{{cite web|url=http://www.play.com/Games/PlayStation3/4-/30844245/-/Product.html |title=Play.com offers the Colonial Assassin pack as a pre-order bonus |publisher=play.com |date= |accessdate=May 8, 2012}} "Redcoat Multiplayer" DLC pack includes redcoat costume, a snake emblem, and a "doctor doll" relic.{{Citation needed|date=May 2016}} In the US, Gamestop is offering the single-player mission ''Lost Mayan Ruins'' and the Sawtooth Sword, Best Buy is offering the single-player mission ''Ghost of War'' and the Pontiac's War Club, while Amazon is offering the Steelbook Case.{{Citation needed|date=May 2016}} [[Sony Computer Entertainment Europe|SCEE]] offers a digital version of ''Assassin's Creed III'' via the [[PlayStation Store]]. Dubbed the "Gold Edition", the download includes the game, PlayStation Vita title ''[[Assassin's Creed III: Liberation]]'' and a Season Pass (a first for the series). Another version of the "Gold Edition" features the game and the Season Pass, but not ''Liberation''. Third version comes with ''Liberation'', but without the Season Pass. All versions include ''A Dangerous Secret'', the extra mission available with the ''Special Edition''.{{cite web|last=Phillips |first=Tom |url=http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2012-06-13-assassins-creed-3-gold-edition-pre-order-price-109-99 |title=Assassin's Creed 3 Gold Edition pre-order price Ł109.99 |publisher=[[Eurogamer]] |date=June 13, 2012 |accessdate=June 26, 2012}} Dutch site Entertainment Business reported that thieves made off with a truck on November 14, 2012, in transporting the entire launch shipment of ''Assassin's Creed III'' on PC for Belgium, the Netherlands and Luxembourg. Ubisoft stated that it won't affect launch as copies will be sourced elsewhere. Those who pre-ordered the ''Join or Die'' edition, however, were affected as allegedly this cannot be re-manufactured. Ubisoft also passed on serial numbers and barcodes to retailers of the stolen games, and placed the same numbers on a blacklist preventing them from receiving online authentication.{{cite web|last=Caruana |first=Christine |url=http://www.computerandvideogames.com/379989/assassins-creed-3-pc-shipment-stolen/ |title=PC News: Assassin's Creed 3 PC shipment stolen |publisher=''[[Computer and Video Games]]'' |date=2012-11-22 |accessdate=2012-12-22}}{{cite web|url=http://www.vg247.com/2012/11/22/assassins-creed-3-benelux-pc-shipment-half-inched-report/ |title=Assassin's Creed 3 Benelux PC shipment half-inched – report |publisher=[[VG247]] |date=2012-11-22 |accessdate=2012-12-22}} American global technology company [[Nvidia]] bundled the PC version of ''Assassin's Creed III'' with its new [[GeForce 600 Series#History|GeForce GTX 650 Ti]]. It is built on the Kepler architecture along with others in the Nvidia's 600 series of GPUs.{{cite web|url=http://www.vg247.com/2012/10/09/assassins-creed-3-to-be-bundled-with-nvidias-geforce-gtx-650-ti/ |title=Assassin's Creed 3 to be bundled with Nvidia's GeForce GTX 650 Ti |publisher=[[VG247]] |date=2012-10-09 |accessdate=2012-12-22}} According to Nvidia, ''Assassin's Creed III'' makes the most of the TXAA technology.{{cite web|url=http://www.vg247.com/2012/11/30/assassins-creed-3-pc-makes-the-most-of-txaa-technology-boasts-nvidia/ |title=Assassin's Creed 3 PC makes the most of TXAA technology, boasts nVidia |publisher=[[VG247]] |date=2012-11-30 |accessdate=2012-12-22}} Ubisoft Australia put together a "very special, very limited" edition of ''Assassin's Creed III'' to auction off in benefit of the [[Sydney Children's Hospital]] Foundation. There are only ten of these editions in the world, and eight of them will be auctioned off to raise money for the Sydney Children's Hospital in Randwick. Each will be auctioned separately between November 30, 2012 and December 17.{{cite web|url=http://www.vg247.com/2012/11/30/assassins-creed-3-ultimate-special-editions-to-be-auctioned-for-charity/ |title=Assassin's Creed 3 ultimate special editions to be auctioned for charity |publisher=[[VG247]] |date=2012-11-30 |accessdate=2012-12-22}} ===Allegations of pro-American and anti-British prejudice=== In June 2012 Ubisoft and in particular its French-Canadian subsidiary [[Ubisoft Montreal]] had to fend off increasing accusations of [[anti-British sentiment|anti-British]] prejudice after trailers and box art depicting the killing of British [[Red coat (British army)|Redcoats]] started to appear.{{cite web|url=http://www.gamesindustry.biz/articles/2012-06-12-assassins-creed-iii-devs-have-nothing-against-the-british|title=Assassin's Creed III devs have "nothing against" the British|last=Williams|first=Mike|publisher=Games Industry|date=June 12, 2012|accessdate=October 26, 2012}} One site described the 'July 4' live-action trailer as "American [[nationalism]]".{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/erikkain/2012/07/04/watch-the-terrible-4th-of-july-assassins-creed-iii-live-action-trailer/|title=Watch The Terrible 4th Of July 'Assassin's Creed III' Live-Action Trailer|last=Kain|first=Eric|date=July 4, 2012|accessdate=February 16, 2015 |publisher=''[[Forbes]]''}} Lead script writer Corey May defended the developers and publisher [[Ubisoft]] from allegations of bigotry and discrimination.{{cite web|url=http://www.computerandvideogames.com/350667/assassins-creed-3-dev-promises-weve-got-nothing-against-the-british/|title=Assassin's Creed 3 dev promises: 'We've got nothing against the British'; Lead writer explains Redcoat blood-fest|last=Harlup|first=Andy|publisher=''[[Computer and Video Games]]'' |date=June 12, 2012|accessdate=October 26, 2012}} This controversy, however, continued because marketing materials continued to depict only the British as the enemy,{{cite web|url=http://gamerant.com/assassins-creed-3-anti-british-bias-brian-154567/|title='Assassin's Creed 3′ Writer Denies British Hate|last=Sipple|first=Brian|date=June 12, 2012|accessdate=October 26, 2012 |publisher=Games Rant}} with a number of gaming news outlets noting US trailers cutting scenes that did seem to depict the protagonist killing Patriots.{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/carolpinchefsky/2012/10/05/how-the-uk-trailer-for-assassins-creed-iii-tops-the-us-version/|title=UK Trailer for Assassin's Creed III Is More Historically Accurate Than the US Version|last=Pinchefsky|first=Carol|publisher=''[[Forbes]]''|date=October 5, 2012|accessdate=October 28, 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://kotaku.com/5949062/heres-the-stuff-from-the-new-assassins-creed-iii-trailer-that-ubisoft-doesnt-want-americans-to-see|title=Here's the Stuff from the New Assassin's Creed III Trailer That Ubisoft Doesn't Want Americans to See|last=Narcisse|first=Evan|publisher=Kotaku|date=October 5, 2012|accessdate=October 28, 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://www.gamezone.com/products/assassin-s-creed-iii/news/ubisoft-censors-american-deaths-in-latest-assassin-s-creed-3-trailer|title=Ubisoft censors American deaths in latest Assassin's Creed 3 trailer|last=Liebl|first=Matt|publisher=GameZone|date=October 5, 2012|accessdate=October 28, 2012}} The publisher eventually decided that the Limited Edition of the game wouldn't be sold in the UK or Europe.{{cite web|url=http://www.escapistmagazine.com/news/view/118227-Assassins-Creed-III-Limited-Edition-for-Americans-Only|title=Assassin's Creed III Limited Edition for Americans Only|last=Lemon|first=Marshall|publisher=''[[The Escapist (magazine)|The Escapist]]''|date=July 3, 2012|accessdate=October 26, 2012}} However upon the game's release, critics said their depiction was balanced and fair. ''[[Official Xbox Magazine|Official Xbox Magazine UK]]'' felt that "the strongest aspect of ACIII is the more mature moral tone – there's none of the anticipated 'yay, America'."{{cite web|url=http://www.oxm.co.uk/47178/reviews/assassins-creed-3-review/?page=2|title=Assassin's Creed OXM UK Review|last=Blyth|first=Jon|publisher=''[[Official Xbox Magazine|Official Xbox Magazine UK]]''|date=October 30, 2012|accessdate=October 30, 2012}} In another review by [[Kotaku]], the reviewer notes "publishers from big video game companies are not known for subtlety or complexity of theme", going on to say "the marketing always suggested that Assassin's Creed III's igniting of the Revolution would be a game of interactive jingoism; its developers always said it was not. The developers were the ones being accurate."{{cite web|url=http://www.kotaku.com.au/2012/10/assassins-creed-iii-the-kotaku-review/|title=Assassin's Creed III: The Kotaku Review|last=Totilo|first=Stephen|publisher=Kotaku|date=October 30, 2012|accessdate=October 30, 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://www.beefjack.com/news/assassins-creed-iii-all-the-targets-are-british-except-theyre-not/|title=They're all British, but they're not|publisher=Beef Jack|accessdate=November 10, 2012|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121114045927/http://beefjack.com/news/assassins-creed-iii-all-the-targets-are-british-except-theyre-not/|archive-date=November 14, 2012|dead-url=yes|df=mdy-all}} ===Retail editions=== On March 26, 2012, Ubisoft announced three collectors' editions of ''Assassin's Creed III'', The ''Freedom'', ''Join Or Die'' and ''Special'' editions, exclusive to [[Europe, the Middle East and Africa|EMEA]] countries and Australia. On June 1, 2012, Ubisoft also announced another collectors' edition of ''Assassin's Creed III'', the ''UbiWorkshop'' Edition. Ubisoft and Sony partnered to offer the game as a bundle with the [[PlayStation 3]] console, which was offered from the day of the game's release.{{cite web|last=Gilbert |first=Ben |url=http://www.joystiq.com/2012/06/04/assassins-creed-3-getting-its-own-ps3-hardware-bundle-comes-wi/ |title=Assassin's Creed 3 getting its own PS3 hardware bundle, comes with 'special DLC' |publisher=Joystiq |date=June 4, 2012 |accessdate=June 8, 2012}} On the day of its release, ''Assassin's Creed III'' on the PlayStation 3 received four exclusive single-player missions, titled ''The Benedict Arnold Missions''. The gameplay revolves around [[Benedict Arnold]] and his connections with turning West Point over to the British. Script writer Matt Turner stated that the Benedict Arnold missions were some of the most historically accurate missions in the game, as "some scenes have the actual words spoken by key players in the events at West Point, according to the records from the court proceedings following what happened."{{cite web|url=http://blog.us.playstation.com/2012/10/23/assassins-creed-iii-expose-benedict-arnold-exclusively-on-ps3/|title=Assassin's Creed III: Expose Benedict Arnold Exclusively on PS3|last=Shuman|first=Sid|date=October 23, 2012|accessdate=October 23, 2012}} *The ''Freedom Edition'' features a retail copy of the game, a steelbook case with cover art drawn by comic artist [[Alex Ross]], George Washington's notebook, a 24 cm figurine of the protagonist Connor and two exclusive [[lithography|lithographs]].{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u8b7nfCecaU|title=Assassin's Creed 3 – Freedom Edition Unboxing Video |publisher=[[YouTube]]}} In-game content included is two exclusive single player missions (''Ghost of War'' and ''Lost Mayan Ruins'') and an additional multiplayer character (''Sharpshooter'').{{cite web|url=http://www.videogamer.com/xbox360/assassins_creed_iii/news/assassins_creed_3_collectors_editions_revealed.html |title=Assassin's Creed 3 Collector's Editions revealed – available to preorder now – Assassin's Creed III for Xbox 360 News |publisher=Videogamer.com |date= |accessdate=April 7, 2012}} *The ''Join Or Die Edition'' features a retail copy of the game, Connor's medallion (the medallion of the Assassins with its curd ladle) and George Washington's notebook. In-game content included is one exclusive single player mission (''Ghost of War'') and an additional multiplayer character (''Sharpshooter''). *The ''Special Edition'' features a retail copy of the game and special packaging. In-game content included is one exclusive single-player mission (''A Dangerous Secret''). *The ''UbiWorkshop Edition'' features a retail copy of the game, the second edition of the ''Assassin's Creed'' Encyclopedia, exclusive packaging, five rare prints, and a new graphic novel titled ''Assassin's Creed: Subject 4''. *The ''Limited Edition'' features a retail copy of the game, a 24 cm figurine of Connor, an embroidered 28" x 48" ''Assassin's Creed''-inspired Colonial flag, a 3" x 3.25" metal belt buckle with the Assassin insignia and George Washington's notebook. In-game content included is an exclusive single player mission (''Lost Mayan Ruins'').{{cite web|last=Robinson |first=Andy |url=http://www.computerandvideogames.com/356334/119-assassins-creed-3-limited-edition-detailed-for-na/ |title=News: $119 Assassin's Creed 3 Limited Edition detailed for NA |publisher=''[[Computer and Video Games]]'' |date=July 3, 2012 |accessdate=July 28, 2012}} This edition is not available in the UK or Europe due to perceived anti-British sentiment portrayed in the content.{{cite web|first=John|last=Funk |url=http://www.escapistmagazine.com/forums/read/7.380731-Assassins-Creed-III-Limited-Edition-for-Americans-Only |title=Assassin's Creed III Limited Edition for Americans Only |publisher=''[[The Escapist (magazine)|The Escapist]]'' |date= |accessdate=October 28, 2012}} *The ''Digital Deluxe Edition'' features a retail copy of the game, George Washington's notebook and the official Assassin's Creed III soundtrack. In-game content included is three exclusive single player missions, two skins (''The Captain of the Aquila's uniform'' and ''The Colonial Assassin outfit'') and two additional multiplayer characters (''Sharpshooter'' and ''Redcoat''). It also includes the Benedict Arnold DLC previously exclusive only to the PS3. The edition is exclusive to PC.{{cite web|url=http://www.cinemablend.com/games/Assassin-Creed-3-Limited-Edition-Digital-Deluxe-Edition-Announced-44181.html |title=Assassin's Creed 3 Limited Edition, Digital Deluxe Edition Announced |publisher=Cinema Blend |date=July 2, 2012 |accessdate=July 28, 2012}} * ''Washington Edition'' includes: all 3 parts of DLC "The Tyranny of King Washington", "The Hidden Secrets Pack" and "The Battle Hardened Pack".http://shop.ubi.com/store/ubiemea/da_DK/pd/ThemeID.8605700/productID.278584100{{cite web|url=http://assassinscreed.ubi.com/de-de/news/news_detail.aspx?c=tcm:25-87102&ct=tcm:6-231-32|title=ASSASSIN'S CREED® III — Die Washington Edition kommt — Assassin's Creed®-News-Offizielle Seite -Ubisoft|publisher=|accessdate=October 6, 2014}}{{cite web|url=https://support.ubi.com/en-gb/FAQ.aspx?platformid=9&brandid=22&productid=2717&faqid=kA030000000eXQnCAM|title=Redeeming the additional content in the Washington Edition — Assassin's Creed 3 - PC — Ubisoft Customer Support Site|publisher=|accessdate=October 6, 2014}} It was released 20 June 2013.{{cite web|url=http://www.ag.ru/games/assassins-creed-3-washington-edition|title= гра Assassin's Creed III: Washington Edition: вся информация об игре, дата выхода, системные требования, купить игру Assassin's Creed III: Washington Edition|publisher=|accessdate=October 6, 2014}} ==Downloadable content== On October 3, 2012 Ubisoft officially revealed a Season Pass for [[downloadable content]] (DLC), made available for a six-month time period on PlayStation Network and on Xbox Live. The pass gives purchasers access to the three ''King Washington'' DLC packs, ''The Hidden Secrets'' pack with all the preorder, retailer exclusive, bonus material, and ''The Battle Hardened'' pack, featuring new maps and characters for multiplayer. Furthermore, players with the pass will have access to DLC a week before other gamers.{{cite web|url=http://www.cinemablend.com/games/Assassin-Creed-3-Tyranny-King-Washington-Single-Player-DLC-Campaign-47708.html|title=Assassin's Creed 3 Tyranny Of King Washington Is Single-Player DLC Campaign|last=Haas|first=Pete|date=October 3, 2012|accessdate=October 27, 2012 |publisher=Cinema Blend}} ===Uplay content=== Ubisoft's [[Uplay]] system enables further in-game enhancements which can be redeemed by points that are given when playing the game. The available awards are an "Assassin's Creed III Theme" (available for the PlayStation 3, Xbox 360 and PC), "The Life Scratcher Pack", which allows the player to increase the capacity of Connor's tool pouches, and unlock exclusive multiplayer profile items, "Ezio's Outfit'", an outfit similar to the one worn by [[Ezio Auditore da Firenze|Ezio Auditore]] in "[[Assassin's Creed: Brotherhood]]", but with a differently colored cape, and "The Renegade Pack", which unlocks the Multiplayer Night Stalker's costume and additional profile items.{{cite web|url=http://uplay.ubi.com/en-US/game/assassin-s-creed-3|title=ASSASSIN'S CREED 3: REWARDS|publisher=uplay.ubi.com|accessdate=February 5, 2013}} ===''The Hidden Secrets'' Pack=== On December 4, 2012, ''The Hidden Secrets'' Pack was released for Season Pass players on the PlayStation 3, Xbox 360 and PC, with all gamers getting the pack December 11, 2012 and Wii U{{cite web|url=http://www.gameinformer.com/b/news/archive/2013/01/17/first-two-assassin-39-s-creed-iii-dlc-packs-now-available-on-wii-u.aspx|title=First Two Assassin's Creed III DLC Packs Now Available On Wii U|last=Marchiafava|first=Jeff|date=January 17, 2013|accessdate=January 17, 2013}} players getting the pack on January 17, 2013. The pack includes three missions (''The Lost Mayan Ruins'', ''The Ghost of War'' and ''A Dangerous Secret''), which unlock the Sawtooth Cutlass, Pontiac War Club, and Flintlock Musket respectively, two single-player costumes (the Captain of the Aquila and the Colonial Assassin), and two multiplayer characters (the Redcoat and the Sharpshooter). All of the content was previously available as preorder bonuses through different retailers, or in different editions of the game.{{cite web|url=http://forums.ubi.com/showthread.php/733730-Assassin-s-Creed-III-Hidden-Secrets-Pack-First-Downloadable-Content?p=8763684#post8763684 |title=Assassin's Creed III Hidden Secrets Pack – First Downloadable Content |publisher=[[Ubisoft]] |date= |accessdate=2012-12-22}} ===''The Battle Hardened'' Pack=== Announced on December 4, 2012 with ''The Hidden Secrets'' Pack, ''The Battle Hardened'' Pack includes new maps and characters for multiplayer.{{cite web|url=http://www.joystiq.com/2012/12/04/assassins-creed-3-season-pass-unlocks-hidden-secrets-dlc-today/|title=Assassin's Creed 3 Season Pass unlocks Hidden Secrets DLC today|last=Kubba|first=Sinan|date=December 4, 2012|accessdate=December 4, 2012}} On January 8, 2013, ''The Battle Hardened'' Pack was released to all players on the PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360, with a PC release on January 15 and Wii U release on January 17. The pack includes the Governor, Highlander and Coyote Man multiplayer characters and the Charlestown, Fort St-Mathieu and Saint Pierre maps.{{cite web|url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2013/01/08/assassins-creed-iii-battle-hardened-dlc-out-now?abthid=50ec490b34e1891c680000ac|title=Assassin's Creed III Battle Hardened DLC Out Now|last=Goldfarb|first=Andrew|date=January 8, 2013|accessdate=January 8, 2013}} ===''The Tyranny of King Washington''=== On October 3, 2012 Ubisoft revealed the first portion of DLC for the game, called ''The Tyranny of King Washington.'' The story revolves around an alternative history "The United Kingdom of America", wherein George Washington has seized an Apple of Eden, becomes corrupted by its power, and dubs himself King. The player is tasked with overthrowing the dictator. The single-player campaign is separated into 3 episodic installments. In the DLC, Ratonhnhaké:ton gains new abilities: the "Power of the Bear" for strength, the "Power of the Eagle" for speed, the "Power of the Wolf" for stealth, "Warpaint" to enhance the abilities, and "Alpha of the Pack", giving the ability to call wolves to help in battle.{{cite web|url=http://assassinscreed.ubi.com/ac3/en-US/news/news_detail.aspx?c=tcm:19-82239&ct=tcm:6-231-32|title=Meet the Tyranny of King Washington's Ratonhnhaké:ton|publisher=Ubisoft.com|date=February 6, 2013|accessdate=February 6, 2013}} On January 24, 2013, the first episode of the DLC was announced, titled "''The Infamy''". Set in 1783, Ratonhnhaké:ton awakens from what appears to be an alternative reality where the events of the main game involving him have never happened. He is tasked to find George Washington, corrupted heavily by the Apple of Eden. Washington has crowned himself King and begun to enslave and massacre the Frontier's population. Ratonhnhaké:ton must do everything in his power to dethrone him to return the land to freedom, including utilizing the new abilities granted to him. The first episode was released on February 19 for Xbox 360 and PC, February 20 for PlayStation 3, and on February 21 for the Wii U.{{cite web|url=http://assassinscreed.ubi.com/ac3/en-US/news/news_detail.aspx?c=tcm:19-80761&ct=tcm:6-231-32|title=The Tyranny of King Washington Draws Near|publisher=Ubisoft|date=January 24, 2013|accessdate=February 4, 2013}} On February 6, 2013, it was announced that the second episode, titled "The Betrayal", would be released on March 19 for Xbox 360, PC and PlayStation 3 and an unknown date for Wii U (available in the eShop as of March 27) and that the third episode, titled "The Redemption", would be released on April 23 for Xbox 360, PC and PlayStation 3. Despite being given a release date of May 16 for Wii U, "The Redemption" has been available in the eShop since April 27.{{cite web|url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2013/02/06/assassins-creed-iii-king-washington-dlc-release-dates?abthid=5112aaf8692769cd4d000013|title=Assassin's Creed III: King Washington DLC Release Dates|last=Clements|first=Ryan|date=February 6, 2013|accessdate=February 6, 2013}} ==Reception== {{Video game reviews | width = 26em | GR = (PS3) 85.56%{{cite web|url=http://www.gamerankings.com/ps3/621796-assassins-creed-iii/index.html|title=Assassin's Creed III (PS3) |publisher=[[GameRankings]] |date= |accessdate=November 28, 2012}}
(X360) 84.92%{{cite web|url=http://www.gamerankings.com/xbox360/621797-assassins-creed-iii/index.html|title=Assassin's Creed III (X360) |publisher=[[GameRankings]] |date= |accessdate=November 28, 2012}}
(WIIU) 83.00%{{cite web|url=http://www.gamerankings.com/wii-u/662540-assassins-creed-iii/index.html|title=Assassin's Creed III (WIIU) |publisher=[[GameRankings]] |date= |accessdate=November 28, 2012}}
(PC) 80.75%{{cite web|url=http://www.gamerankings.com/pc/662288-assassins-creed-iii/index.html|title=Assassin's Creed III (PC) |publisher=[[GameRankings]] |date= |accessdate=November 28, 2012}} | MC = (PS3) 85/100{{cite web|url=http://www.metacritic.com/game/playstation-3/assassins-creed-iii |title=Assassin's Creed III for PlayStation 3 – Reviews, Ratings, Credits, and More |publisher=[[Metacritic]] |date= |accessdate=November 28, 2012}}
(WIIU) 85/100{{cite web|url=http://www.metacritic.com/game/wii-u/assassins-creed-iii |title=Assassin's Creed III for Wii U – Reviews, Ratings, Credits, and More |publisher=[[Metacritic]] |date= |accessdate=November 28, 2012}}
(X360) 84/100{{cite web|url=http://www.metacritic.com/game/xbox-360/assassins-creed-iii |title=Assassin's Creed III for Xbox 360 – Reviews, Ratings, Credits, and More |publisher=[[Metacritic]] |date= |accessdate=November 28, 2012}}
(PC) 80/100{{cite web|url=http://www.metacritic.com/game/pc/assassins-creed-iii |title=Assassin's Creed III for PC – Reviews, Ratings, Credits, and More |publisher=[[Metacritic]] |date= |accessdate=November 28, 2012}} | Edge = 8/10{{cite web|url=http://www.edge-online.com/review/assassins-creed-iii-review/ |title=Assassin's Creed III review |publisher=''[[Edge (magazine)|Edge]]'' |date= |accessdate=November 9, 2012}} | EuroG = 9/10{{cite web|last=Bramwell |first=Tom |url=http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2012-10-30-assassins-creed-3-review |title=Assassin's Creed 3 review • Reviews • Xbox 360 • |publisher=[[Eurogamer]] |date=October 30, 2012 |accessdate=November 9, 2012}} | G4 = 5/5 | GI = 9.5/10 | GSpot = 8.5/10 | GRadar = {{Rating|4|5}}{{cite web|url=http://www.gamesradar.com/assassins-creed-iii-review/ |title=Assassin's Creed III Review |publisher=[[GamesRadar]] |date=October 30, 2012 |accessdate=November 9, 2012}} | GT = 9.2/10{{cite web|url=http://www.gametrailers.com/reviews/455lbk/assassin-s-creed-iii-review|title=REVIEW – Assassin's Creed III|accessdate=October 30, 2012 |publisher=[[GameTrailers]]}} | IGN = 8.5/10 | Joystiq = {{Rating|3.5|5}}{{cite web|url=http://www.joystiq.com/2012/10/30/assassins-creed-3-review-declination-of-independence/ |title=Assassin's Creed 3 review: Declination of independence|publisher=Joystiq |date=October 30, 2012 |accessdate=October 30, 2012 |first=Ludwig |last=Kietzmann}} | OPMUK = 7/10{{cite web |url=http://www.officialplaystationmagazine.co.uk/review/assassins-creed-3-ps3-review-struggling-to-break-the-shackles-of-the-old-world/2/ |publisher=[[PlayStation Official Magazine - UK|''PlayStation Official Magazine'' (UK)]] |accessdate=November 20, 2012 |date=October 30, 2012 |first=Joel |last=Gregory |title=Assassin's Creed 3 PS3 review – struggling to break the shackles of the old world |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121102181126/http://www.officialplaystationmagazine.co.uk/review/assassins-creed-3-ps3-review-struggling-to-break-the-shackles-of-the-old-world/2/ |archivedate=November 2, 2012 |df=mdy-all }} | OXM = 8.5/10 }} ''Assassin's Creed III'' received positive reviews, with critics praising the visuals, narrative, combat style, hunting mechanics, naval missions and Homestead system, while complaining about the game's glitches and some of the missions' prescriptive layouts. Aggregating review websites [[GameRankings]] and [[Metacritic]] gave the PlayStation 3 version 85.56% and 85/100, the Xbox 360 version 84.92% and 84/100, the Wii U version 83.00% and 85/100, and the PC version 80.75% and 80/100. Daniel Bischoff of [[GameRevolution]] gave it 5/5 stars, saying "Combining the best of the franchise so far, ASSASSIN'S CREED III doesn't disappoint long-time fans who've been with the series while also making it easy enough to jump in for the kill."http://www.gamerevolution.com/review/57743-assassins-creed-iii-review [[IGN]] gave the game a score of 8.5/10, saying "It achieves so much that you can't help but respect it, no other open world game has ever given us a setting that's as impressive to observe or as full of things to do as this". They did however say "Not everything about the game gels together convincingly and the missions' unnecessary prescriptiveness sometimes undermines the sense of freedom that the rest of the game works so hard to create".{{cite web | url = http://www.ign.com/articles/2012/10/30/assassins-creed-iii-review | title = Assassin's Creed III Review | accessdate = October 30, 2012 | publisher = IGN }} [[GameSpot]] gave a similar review, stating "It takes chances with its opening, with its story, and with its characters. It expands the series' gameplay in enjoyable and sensible ways. As with many ambitious games, not every arrow fired hits the bull's eye, yet this big, narratively rich sequel is easy to get invested in" and gave a score of 8.5/10.{{cite web | url = http://www.gamespot.com/assassins-creed-iii/reviews/assassins-creed-iii-review-6399036/ | title = Assassin's Creed III (Xbox 360) Review | accessdate = October 30, 2012 | publisher = [[GameSpot]] }} ''[[Game Informer]]'' awarded the game 9.5/10, saying "''Assassin's Creed III'' delivers everything the series has promised, and throws in a little more for good measure ... Most players will likely spend the first six hours of ''Assassin's Creed III'' wrapping their heads around the profound size and ambition of the game".{{cite web|url=http://www.gameinformer.com/games/assassins_creed_iii/b/xbox360/archive/2012/10/30/assassin-39-s-creed-iii-review-staggering-scope-and-breadth.aspx|title=Assassin's Creed III Staggering Scope And Breadth|last=Miller|first=Matt|date=October 30, 2012|accessdate=October 30, 2012 |publisher=''[[Game Informer]]''}} [[G4 (U.S. TV channel)|G4]] felt that "''Assassins Creed III'' [was] not perfect ... But there is so much story, so much multiplayer, and so much stuff to do that your average 10 hour game should be terribly ashamed of itself".{{cite web|last=Webb |first=Morgan |url=http://www.g4tv.com/games/xbox-360/65904/assassins-creed-3/review/ |title=Assassin's Creed 3 Review for Xbox 360 |publisher=[[G4 (U.S. TV channel)|G4TV]] |date= |accessdate=October 30, 2012}} ''[[Official Xbox Magazine]]'' gave it 8.5/10, and said "[Its] newly refined gameplay and incredibly rich setting are captivating stuff ... It improves on the underlying ''Assassin's Creed'' formula in a handful of subtle but tangible ways ... And its unwavering commitment to storytelling is both rare and impressive". They did however criticize, "Pacing problems which can drag the campaign into busy-work tedium".{{cite web|url=http://www.oxmonline.com/assassins-creed-iii-review?page=0,1|title=Assassin's Creed 3 Review|publisher=''[[Official Xbox Magazine]]''|accessdate=October 30, 2012}} ''[[PC Gamer]]'' was more critical, giving the game a 72/100 and stating that ''Assassin's Creed III'' had "Entertaining storytelling and fantastic naval combat marred by terrible mission design and endemic feature creep"{{cite web|url=http://www.pcgamer.com/review/assassins-creed-3-review/ |title= Assassin's Creed III Review |accessdate = December 4, 2012 |publisher = ''[[PC Gamer]]'' }} The reviewer felt that homesteading detracted from the central theme and story, and narrowly scripted optional objectives punished players for thinking laterally. "It's about pattern recognition rather than creative thought, binary reactions with no room for life or dynamism." In December 2015, ''[[Game Informer]]'' ranked the game as the ninth best game in the ''Assassin's Creed'' series to date.{{cite web|url=https://www.gameinformer.com/b/features/archive/2015/12/13/ranking-the-entire-assassin-s-creed-series.aspx|title=Ranking The Entire Assassin's Creed Series|last=Juba|first=Joe|work=Game Informer|publisher=GameStop|date=December 4, 2015|accessdate=December 5, 2015}} ===Awards=== ''Assassin's Creed III'' was nominated for six awards in the 2012 [[Spike Video Game Awards]]: Game of the Year, Best Xbox 360 Game, Best PS3 Game, Best Action Adventure Game, Best Graphics, and Character of the Year (Connor).{{cite web|agency=Associated Press |url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/entertainment/journey-assassins-creed-iii-among-spike-video-game-awards-nominees/2012/11/15/bc1d9fa0-2fa5-11e2-af17-67abba0676e2_story.html |title='Journey,' 'Assassin's Creed III' among Spike Video Game Awards nominees |publisher=''[[The Washington Post]]'' |date=November 16, 2012 |accessdate=November 28, 2012}} GameTrailers awarded Assassin's Creed 3 Best Action-Adventure Game of the Year 2012 while [[Game Revolution]] named ''Assassin's Creed III'' its Game of the Year 2012. For the 2013 [[Academy of Interactive Arts & Sciences|D.I.C.E. Interactive Achievement Awards]], the game won the award for ''Outstanding Achievement in Animation'' and was nominated for ''Adventure Game of the Year'', and ''Outstanding Achievement in Sound Design''.{{cite web|first= |last= |url=http://www.interactive.org/images/awards/16th-Annual-D.I.C.E.-Finalists-For-Web.pdf |title=Academy of Interactive Arts & Sciences – 16th Annual D.I.C.E. Awards Finalists |publisher=[[Academy of Interactive Arts & Sciences]] |work= |date=January 14, 2013 |accessdate=January 14, 2013 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6EHEUcRtJ?url=http://www.interactive.org/images/awards/16th-Annual-D.I.C.E.-Finalists-For-Web.pdf |archivedate=February 8, 2013 |deadurl=no |format=PDF |df=mdy }}{{cite web|first=Alexander |last=Sliwinski |url=http://www.joystiq.com/2013/02/08/journey-takes-game-of-the-year-at-dice-awards/ |title=Journey takes 'Game of the Year' at DICE awards |publisher=Joystiq |work= |date=February 8, 2013 |accessdate=February 8, 2013 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6EHESixoW?url=http://www.joystiq.com/2013/02/08/journey-takes-game-of-the-year-at-dice-awards/ |archivedate=February 8, 2013 |deadurl=no |format=PDF |df=mdy }} ''Assassin's Creed III'' also received four [[Game Developer's Choice Awards]] nominations for ''Best Audio'', ''Best Narrative'', ''Best Technology'', and ''Game of the Year''.{{cite web|first=Evan |last=Narcisse |url=http://kotaku.com/5978790/here-are-the-2012-games-that-game-developers-want-to-give-awards-to |title=Here Are the 2012 Games That Developers Want to Give Awards to |publisher=Gawker Media |work=Kotaku |date=January 24, 2013 |accessdate=January 24, 2013 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6DvA2Wlaq?url=http://kotaku.com/5978790/here-are-the-2012-games-that-game-developers-want-to-give-awards-to |archivedate=January 24, 2013 |deadurl=no |df=mdy }} {| class="wikitable collapsible collapsed" style="width:100%;" |- !List of awards and nominations for ''Assassin's Creed III'' |- |style="padding:0; border:none;"| {|class="wikitable" style="border:none; margin:0; width:100%;" |- ! |publisher=[[Game Developers Choice Awards]]|date=March 27, 2013|accessdate=December 10, 2013}} |- | Best Technology | ''Assassin's Creed III'' | {{Nom}} |} |} ===Sales=== On March 30, 2012, Ubisoft stated that in the three weeks since the game's pre-order campaign began, numbers had already surpassed the total U.S. pre-order numbers of ''[[Assassin's Creed: Brotherhood]]'' and exceeded 10 times more than the pre-orders ''[[Assassin's Creed: Revelations]]'' attracted in a comparable time frame.{{cite web |author=PDT |url=http://asia.gamespot.com/news/assassins-creed-iii-setting-ubisoft-preorder-records-6368828 |title=Assassin's Creed III setting Ubisoft preorder records — GameSpot.com |publisher=[[GameSpot]] |date=March 29, 2012 |accessdate=April 7, 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120401234257/http://asia.gamespot.com/news/assassins-creed-iii-setting-ubisoft-preorder-records-6368828 |archivedate=April 1, 2012 |df=mdy-all }} On October 25, 2012, Ubisoft announced that the game is the most pre-ordered game in the company's history, more than doubling pre-orders for ''Revelations'', the previous record holder.{{cite web|url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2012/10/25/assassins-creed-iii-pre-orders-break-ubisoft-record?abthid=50896fcbf6090bd57d000033|title=Assassin's Creed III Pre-Orders Break Ubisoft Record|last=Goldfarb|first=Andrew|date=October 25, 2012|accessdate=October 25, 2012 |publisher=IGN}} ''Assassin's Creed III'' was the bestselling game in the United Kingdom in the week of its release, with the best sales of the series to date. It was the biggest launch in publisher Ubisoft's history and the third biggest launch of any game in the UK in 2012 (behind ''[[Call of Duty: Black Ops II]]'' and ''[[FIFA 13]]''). It doubled the launch week sales of ''[[Assassin's Creed II]]'', and beat 2011's ''Revelations'' by over 117,000 copies.{{cite web|last=Phillips |first=Tom |url=http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2012-11-05-uk-charts-assassins-creed-3-top-second-biggest-launch-of-the-year |title=UK chart: Assassin's Creed 3 top, second biggest launch of the year |publisher=[[Eurogamer]] |date=November 5, 2012 |accessdate=November 9, 2012}}{{cite web|url=http://www.theinquirer.net/inquirer/news/2222373/assassin-s-creed-3-making-a-killing-in-the-uk-games-charts|title=AC3 Sales|publisher=The Inquirer|accessdate=November 5, 2012}} According to Ubisoft, ''Assassin's Creed III'' sold over 3.5 million units in its first week, which represents a 100 percent year-over-year increase from ''Revelations''.{{cite web|last=Matulef |first=Jeffrey |url=http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2012-11-06-assassins-creed-3-sales-estimated-at-over-3-5-million-units |title=Assassin's Creed 3 sales estimated at over 3.5 million units |publisher=[[Eurogamer]] |date=November 6, 2012 |accessdate=November 28, 2012}} On December 12, 2012, Ubisoft announced that the game had sold 7 million copies worldwide.{{cite web|url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2012/12/12/assassins-creed-iii-sales-pass-7-million |title=Assassin's Creed III Sales Pass 7 Million |publisher=IGN |date= |accessdate=2012-12-22}} In the United Kingdom, ''Assassin's Creed III'' was the 3rd bestselling title of 2012, after being on sale for 2 months.{{cite web|first=Christopher |last=Ding |url=http://www.mcvuk.com/news/read/call-of-duty-black-ops-ii-dominates-uk-2012-charts/0108868 |title=Revealed: The UK's Top 20 bestselling games of 2012 |publisher=[[Market for Home Computing and Video Games]] |date=January 4, 2013 |accessdate=January 4, 2013 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6DQlfVlEG?url=http://www.mcvuk.com/news/read/call-of-duty-black-ops-ii-dominates-uk-2012-charts/0108868 |archivedate=January 4, 2013 |deadurl=no |df=mdy }} According to the [[NPD Group]], the game was the 4th bestselling game of 2012 in North America.{{cite web|first=Jordan |last=Mallory |url=http://www.joystiq.com/2013/01/10/december-npd-2012-sales-hit-13-26-billion-black-ops-2-leads-t/ |title=December NPD: 2012 sales hit $13.26 billion, Black Ops 2 leads the pack |publisher=AOL |work=Joystiq |date=January 10, 2013 |accessdate=January 11, 2013 |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/6Da2gjZ6A?url=http://www.joystiq.com/2013/01/10/december-npd-2012-sales-hit-13-26-billion-black-ops-2-leads-t/ |archivedate=January 11, 2013 |deadurl=no |df=mdy }} On February 7, 2013, Ubisoft announced that the game had sold 12 million copies worldwide, representing an almost 70 percent increase over ''Revelations'' at the same point of its lifecycle, and making it the best-selling game in the franchise.{{cite web|last=Ivan |first=Tom |url=http://www.computerandvideogames.com/389939/assassins-creed-3-12-million-sales-boost-ubisofts-q3/ |title=News: Assassin's Creed 3: 12 million sales boost Ubisoft's Q3 |publisher=ComputerAndVideoGames.com |date=2013-02-07 |accessdate=2013-02-21}} ===Technical issues=== On November 14, 2012, Ubisoft reassured that the PC version of ''Assassin's Creed III'' will launch with fewer bugs than the PlayStation 3 and Xbox 360 versions. A new patch was in the works to fix glitches on all versions. It was the second title update for the game following a large patch available day-one. The PC launch came with both of these patches included.{{cite web|last=Phillips |first=Tom |url=http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2012-11-14-assassins-creed-3-pc-will-be-less-buggy-than-the-console-versions-at-launch |title=Assassin's Creed 3 PC "will be less buggy than the console versions" at launch |publisher=[[Eurogamer]] |date=November 14, 2012 |accessdate=November 28, 2012}} After two days, Ubisoft detailed the sizable patch scheduled for release across the major platforms. This extensive patch was designed to address a list of around one hundred identified bugs present within the single-player campaign and online multiplayer modes plaguing the player experience. Some of the problems outlined involve substantial environmental instability, severe NPC technical issues, occasional console crashes and various issues involving sound synchronization amongst others.{{cite web|last=Phillips |first=Tom |url=http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2012-11-16-huge-assassins-creed-3-patch-detailed |title=Ubisoft details huge Assassin's Creed 3 patch |publisher=[[Eurogamer]] |date=November 16, 2012 |accessdate=November 28, 2012}} ==Series continuation== {{Main|Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag}} {{quote box|align=right|width=25em|Assassin's Creed is all about cycles – we have the Ezio cycle and the Altair cycle, and both of those are set to conclude in ''Revelations'' and we have the Desmond cycle, which is set to end on December 2012. But there's many cycles within the brand – that's the whole point. History is our playground.|source = —Alexandre Amancio, game director of ''Assassin's Creed: Revelations'', in October 2011{{cite web|last=Pereira|first=Chris|title=Expect a Larger Gap Between Future Assassin's Creed Releases|url=http://www.1up.com/news/expect-larger-gap-between-assassins-creed-games|publisher=1up}}}} In September 2012, franchise main writer [[Corey May]] stated that the ''Assassin's Creed III'' plot leaves possible sequels "plenty of room to play".{{cite web|last=Jackson|first=Mike|title=Assassin's Creed 3 plot leaves possible sequels 'plenty of room to play'|url=http://www.computerandvideogames.com/369899/assassins-creed-3-plot-leaves-possible-sequels-plenty-of-room-to-play/|publisher=CVG}} ''Assassin's Creed III'' associate producer Julien Laferrière said that further ''Assassin's Creed'' games featuring new hero Connor depend on reaction to character, stating "We made three games with Ezio because people loved Ezio."{{cite web|last=Phillips|first=Tom|title=Ubisoft: Assassin's Creed 3 sequels depend on reaction to new hero Connor|url=http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2012-09-24-assassins-creed-3-sequels-depend-on-player-reaction-to-new-hero-connor|publisher=Eurogamer}} In November 2012, The Gaming Liberty spotted a supposed Ubisoft survey that suggested another annual installment could be set for release next year. The survey asked participants how they would feel about a return of Desmond, Connor and the American Revolution setting, and if they would purchase such a title if it were to be released next year, suggesting that Ubisoft had its eye on repeating the ''Brotherhood'' and ''Revelations'' route of the Ezio trilogy. The survey was also said to ask how participants would feel about the introduction of a co-op mode, and how they feel about Naughty Dog's ''Uncharted 3: Drake's Deception'', possibly suggesting a move to more scripted gameplay.{{cite web|url=http://www.computerandvideogames.com/381043/assassins-creed-4-survey-suggests-2013-sequel-with-co-op/|title=Assassin's Creed survey suggests 2013 sequel with co-op|first=Andy|last=Robinson|publisher=ComputerAndVideoGames.com|accessdate=2012-01-20}}{{cite web|url=http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2012-11-29-would-you-like-co-op-in-the-next-assassins-creed|title=Would you like co-op in the next Assassin's Creed?|last=Yin-Poole|first=Wesley|publisher=[[Eurogamer]]|accessdate=2012-01-20}} On February 28, 2013, Ubisoft posted their first promotional picture and cover for their next ''Assassin's Creed'' game, following leaked marketing material days before.{{cite web|url=http://kotaku.com/5987035/assassins-creed-iv-is-all-about-pirates-according-to-this-poster|title=Assassin's Creed IV Is All About Pirates, According To This Poster|last=Schreier|first=Jason|publisher=Kotaku.com|date=February 26, 2013|accessdate=February 26, 2013}} Titled ''Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag'', it serves as a sequel to ''Assassin's Creed III''{{'}}s modern story and a prequel to its ancestral storyline. The game is set in the [[Caribbean]] islands during the [[Golden Age of Piracy]], and centers around Edward Kenway; the father of Haytham Kenway, and grandfather of Ratonhnhaké:ton, the playable characters of ''Assassin's Creed III''. ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} ==External links== {{Commons category}} {{wikivoyage|Assassin's Creed Tour|Assassin's Creed: Brotherhood}} *{{official website|http://assassinscreed.ubi.com/}} {{Portal bar|Video games|2010s}} {{Assassin's Creed}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Assassin's Creed 03}} [[Category:2012 video games]] [[Category:Action-adventure games]] Jill Murray | composer = [[Winifred Phillips]]

{{vgrelease|NA|October 30, 2012|EU|October 31, 2012|AU|October 31, 2012|JP|November 15, 2012}}'''''Liberation HD'''''
'''PlayStation 3'''{{vgrelease|NA|January 14, 2014|EU|January 15, 2014|AU|January 15, 2014}}'''Microsoft Windows, Xbox 360'''
{{vgrelease|WW|January 15, 2014{{cite web|url=http://www.computerandvideogames.com/440493/assassins-creed-liberation-hd-hits-xbox-360-january-15/|title=Assassin's Creed Liberation HD hits Xbox 360 January 15|last=Jackson|first=Mike|publisher=Computer and Videogames|date=November 27, 2013|accessdate=December 21, 2013}}}}'''''Liberation Remastered'''''
'''PlayStation 4''' & '''Xbox One'''{{Video game release|WW|March 2019}}{{cite web|url=http://www.ign.com/articles/2018/09/13/assassins-creed-odysseys-dlc-announced-assassins-creed-iii-remastered-included|title=Assassin's Creed Odyssey's DLC announced, Assassin's Creed III Remastered included|last=Stevens|first=Colin|publisher=IGN|date=September 13, 2018|accessdate=September 17, 2018}} | genre = [[Action-adventure game|Action-adventure]], [[Stealth game|stealth]] | modes = [[Single-player video game|Single-player]], [[Multiplayer video game|multiplayer]] }} '''''Assassin's Creed III: Liberation''''' is a 2012 [[Action-adventure game|action-adventure]] video game developed and published by [[Ubisoft]], initially as an exclusive title for [[PlayStation Vita]]. [[Sony]] announced the game at its press conference during the [[Electronic Entertainment Expo 2012]], few days after first leaks about the game presented in ''[[Game Informer]]''.{{cite web|url=http://psp-team.pl/newsy/e3-2012-wyciek%C5%82y-pierwsze-informacje-o-assassins-creed-3-liberation-dla-ps-vita-14104/ |title=E3 2012: Wyciekły pierwsze informacje o Assassin's Creed 3: Liberation dla PS Vita | PSP-team — O kieszonkach Sony PS Vita i PSP |publisher=Psp-team.pl |date= |accessdate=November 17, 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121004135139/http://psp-team.pl/newsy/e3-2012-wyciek%C5%82y-pierwsze-informacje-o-assassins-creed-3-liberation-dla-ps-vita-14104 |archivedate=October 4, 2012 }} It was released on October 30, 2012 alongside ''[[Assassin's Creed III]]'', with which it can be linked.{{cite web|last=Mallory |first=Jordan |url=http://www.joystiq.com/2012/06/04/assassins-creed-3-liberation-confirmed-for-vita-launches-octo/ |title=Assassin's Creed 3: Liberation confirmed for Vita, launches October 30 [Update!] |publisher=Joystiq |date=June 4, 2012 |accessdate=November 17, 2012}} The game was re-released as '''''Assassin's Creed: Liberation HD''''' for the [[PlayStation 3]], [[Xbox 360]] and [[Microsoft Windows]] via the [[PlayStation Network]], [[Xbox Live Arcade]] and [[Steam (software)|Steam]],{{cite web|url=http://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2013-09-10-assassins-creed-liberation-hd-confirmed-for-2014-release|title=Assssin's Ceed Liberation HD confirmed for 2014 release|last=Phillips|first=Tom|publisher=Eurogamer.net|date=September 10, 2013|accessdate=September 10, 2013}} respectively. It was later packed as part of "Assassin's Creed The Americas Collection" for the [[PlayStation 3]] and [[Xbox 360]], along with ''[[Assassin's Creed III]]'' and ''[[Assassin's Creed IV: Black Flag]]''. In May 2019, the game will be re-released as a part of ''[[Assassin's Creed III|Assassin's Creed III Remastered]]'' for [[Playstation 4]], [[Xbox One]], and [[Microsoft Windows]]. The plot is set in a [[historical fiction|fictional history]] of real world events and follows the centuries-old struggle between the [[Assassins]], who fight for peace with free will, and the [[Knights Templar|Templars]], who desire peace through control. The game is set between 1765 and 1777, and primarily features the series' first female protagonist, [[Aveline de Grandpré]], an African-French Assassin around the end of the [[French and Indian War]], in 18th century [[New Orleans]]. ==Gameplay== ''Assassin's Creed III: Liberation'' retains the "franchise's trademark open world and gameplay", while making use of the [[PlayStation Vita]]'s touchscreen and rear touch pad, cameras and gyroscope. These include Chain Kill combat, and the ability to pickpocket people.{{cite web|author=Tim Torres (228 Posts) |url=http://www.2d-x.com/assassins-creed-iii-liberations-head-writer-walks-me-through-a-demo/ |title=Assassin's Creed III: Liberation PS Vita |publisher=2D-X |date= |accessdate=November 17, 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121113134334/http://www.2d-x.com/assassins-creed-iii-liberations-head-writer-walks-me-through-a-demo/ |archivedate=November 13, 2012 }} By linking the game to ''Assassin's Creed III'', the player receives an in-game version of Connor's tomahawk, an exclusive character skin, a multiplayer character and a complete upgrade of all ammunition pouches. The game uses the same engine that runs ''Assassin's Creed III'', allowing for the same gameplay experience as a console release. Aveline also has her own new set of animations as well as have the ability to dual-wield weapons, such as the new blowpipe as well as the familiar swords, knives, pistols and hidden blade.{{cite journal|last1=Miller|first1=Matt|title=Assassin's Creed III Liberation: The first 10 things you need to know|journal=Game Informer|issue=231 July 2012|pages=78–81}} The multiplayer, exclusive to the original Vita version, consists of players tapping nodes on a map, using characters (represented with static portraits) to capture bases and collect supplies, among other things. This differs from the series usual competitive multiplayer which had players assassinating each other for sport. ==Plot== In the modern day, Abstergo Entertainment, a subsidiary of Abstergo which is in charge of producing multimedia goods, releases their first major product, ''Liberation'', a video game about the life of the Assassin [[Aveline de Grandpré]]. The game, however, is heavily censored, with any details regarding the Assassin-[[Knights Templar|Templar]] war being omitted, in an attempt to portray the Assassins as the villainous force. As the player progresses through the game, they are greeted by messages from a group of hackers known as Erudito, giving them access to the full story hidden behind Abstergo's censoring attempts. The main portion of the game takes place in [[Louisiana]] near the end of the [[French and Indian War]], where [[Kingdom of France|France]]'s defeat caused the city of [[New Orleans]] to be taken over by the [[Spanish Empire]]. The citizens were upset over the transition from French to Spanish control and Spain's new occupation within the city. However, in 1765, the French governor [[Jean-Jacques Blaise d'Abbadie]] made a negotiation with Templar Rafael Joaquín de Ferrer to stay as governor of New Orleans. This plot was later uncovered by Aveline, who infiltrated the governor's mansion and assassinated him. Following this, de Ferrer made another deal with a man named Baptiste, who was hoping to defect from the Assassins to the Templar Order. Baptiste took on the identity of the recently deceased François Mackandal, as a ruse to attract followers to his cause. His plan was to poison New Orleans' nobles and take control of smuggling operations within the Louisiana [[Bayou]], although his sole purpose was actually to force Agaté, Assassin and mentor to Aveline, out of hiding in the bayou. His plot failed however, as Aveline tracked Baptiste down, killed his followers and assassinated the false Mackandal. In 1766, the Templar [[Antonio de Ulloa]] arrived in New Orleans, to serve as the Spanish governor. However, he left control of the area to French officials and allowed the French flag to remain over the city. Two years afterwards, he made strict trade restrictions and set up a covert slave-trading operation to transport slaves to a Templar worksite in [[New Spain|Mexico]], creating a rebellion among French officials and the citizens of New Orleans. Agaté ordered Aveline to assassinate de Ulloa to eradicate Templar presence in New Orleans. Aveline ambushed de Ulloa's carriage and confronted the governor, who told her that slaves had been taken to [[Chichen Itza|Chichén Itzá]]. However, Aveline spared his life and let Ulloa leave the city, in return for a lens used to decode Templar documents and a map leading her to the Templar worksite in Chichén Itzá. Aveline's act of mercy destroyed any trust Agaté had in his student, as she had disobeyed his explicit orders. Aveline disguised herself as a slave bound for Mexico and made her way to the Templar worksite at Chichén Itzá. Whilst there, she came across a defiant slave who mentioned that Jeanne, Aveline's mother, was stationed in Chichén Itzá. Aveline investigated thoroughly and uncovered a page from Jeanne's diary and a map that lead to an artifact located inside a cenote. Upon exploring this cave system, she came across an ancient chamber filled with ruins from the [[First Civilization]], along with a fragment of the artifact she was searching for, known as the Prophecy Disk. Aveline then encountered de Ferrer, and killed him and his men. She was reunited with her mother who, after inadvertently revealing that she and Madeleine are Templars, warns her not to let the disk fall into Agaté's hands. Two years later, Aveline returned to New Orleans to find that a man by the name of Vázquez was using Spanish soldiers to seize control of the bayou. She suspected him to be the head Templar of Louisiana, a.k.a. the Company Man, who de Ferrer had mentioned in Chichén Itzá. After retrieving the final piece of the Prophecy Disk in Chichén Itzá, Aveline went back to New Orleans once more to begin her quest in freeing slaves in the city. Her stepmother, Madeleine de L'Isle, became aware of her work and asked her to help a slave named George escape north. Whilst escorting him through the swamp, she met with her smuggler allies Élise Lafleur and Roussillon, helping them to deliver supplies to American Patriots who were fighting in the American Revolutionary War. Vázquez attempted to stop Aveline and her allies by sending Spanish soldiers their way, but Aveline defeated them and ensured George and the supplies reached their destination. After returning to the city, Aveline attended a governor's ball under disguise and managed to get close to Vázquez and assassinate him. However, to her surprise, Vázquez revealed that he was not the Company Man. Following this, Aveline learned that her father, who had been ill for some time, had died. In 1777, Aveline headed to the [[New York (state)|New York]] Frontier, and teamed up with the Assassin Connor to find a Templar officer who was working for the Company Man. She discovered the officer to be George, the same slave she had freed years before, and the Company Man was none other than Madeleine. After confronting her stepmother at her mansion, Aveline traveled to the bayou and met with Agaté to inform him of her discovery. Agaté was unable to accept his failure and believing that Aveline had sided with the Templars, attacked her. Aveline overpowered him and attempted to convince him to leave Louisiana for his own safety, but Agaté could not live with the humiliation and instead chose to dive to his death. On realizing this, Aveline quickly attempted to save him, but only managed to grasp his necklace which tore away from his neck. Following her mentor's death, Aveline saw her situation as an opportunity to infiltrate the Templars and eradicate it from within. Upon returning to New Orleans, she made her way to the [[St. Louis Cathedral (New Orleans)|Saint Louis Cathedral]] and gave Madeleine Agaté's necklace to show her allegiance. Following this, she was inducted into the Templar Order by her stepmother. At this point, the Abstergo version of the game ends, but a final 'Erudito' mission reveals the true, uncensored ending. After her induction, Aveline gave Madeleine the two halves of the Prophecy Disk. However, she could not make sense of the scrambled messages within. Aveline saw this as her moment to strike and reclaim the Prophecy Disk. She eliminated all the Templars inside the cathedral and assassinated Madeleine. Now alone inside the cathedral, Aveline stepped up to the altar where the Prophecy Disk had been placed. She connected the locket she wore around her neck, which once belonged to her mother, to the artifact, causing it to display a holographic recording detailing a message from the time of the First Civilization. This message recounted the election of Eve as the leader of the rebellion during the Human-First Civilization War. ==Release== ''Assassin's Creed III: Liberation'' was released on October 30, 2012, the same day as ''Assassin's Creed III''. The game is available in a PS Vita bundle pack with a new crystal white Wi-Fi Vita and a 4GB memory card. In Japan it was released under the title ''Assassin's Creed III: Lady Liberty''.{{cite web|url=http://kotaku.com/5920985/assassins-creed-iii-liberation-has-a-slightly-different-name-in-japan |title=Assassin's Creed III: Liberation Has a Slightly Different Name in Japan |publisher=Kotaku.com |date=June 25, 2012 |accessdate=November 17, 2012}} It was announced on September 10, 2013, that the game would be re-released as ''Assassin's Creed: Liberation HD'' for [[PlayStation 3]], [[Xbox 360]] and [[Microsoft Windows]] via the [[PlayStation Network]], [[Xbox Live Arcade]] and [[Steam (software)|Steam]], respectively, in 2014. The game features visuals closer to ''III'' as well as updated audio, AI and facial animations. Additional missions have been added and some of the Vita-specific touch screen missions have been removed, as well as the nodes multiplayer and a minor Quick Time Event minigame. The game was released on the PlayStation 3 on January 14, 2014 in North America and January 15, 2014 in Europe. The Microsoft Windows and Xbox 360 versions were released worldwide on January 15, 2014.{{cite web|url=http://blog.ubi.com/assassins-creed-liberation-hd-release-date-pre-order-bonus/|title=ASSASSIN'S CREED LIBERATION HD – RELEASE DATE AND PRE-ORDER BONUSES|last=Lewis|first=Anne|work=UbiBlog|publisher=Ubisoft|date=October 24, 2013|accessdate=October 24, 2013}} It was announced on September 13, 2018 that ''[[Assassin's Creed III|Assassin's Creed III Remastered]]'' would be included in the ''[[Assassin's Creed: Odyssey]]'' [[season pass]]. Assassin's Creed III Remastered was announced to include all of its original DLC and a remastered version of Assassin's Creed III Liberation. ==Additional content== Purchasing ''[[Assassin's Creed III]]'' for the [[PlayStation 3]] gives the player the ability to connect ''Liberation'' and receive an exclusive mission to play in ''Liberation'' as Connor or Aveline, a Multiplayer Skin and an Ammunition Pouch. There was also a promotional DLC, titled Mysteries of the Bayou pack, that came with pre-orders of the game in PAL regions. It included an exclusive weapon, an alligator hunting hat, a Multiplayer Skin and Ammunition Pouches for smoke bombs and poison darts. These all feature in the HD remaster, save for the multiplayer skin, as that feature was removed. ==Music== {{Infobox album | name = Assassin's Creed 3: Liberation (Original Game Soundtrack) | type = Soundtrack | artist = [[Winifred Phillips]] | cover = File:Assassin'sCreedIIILiberationOSTCover.jpg | alt = | released = October 30, 2012 | recorded = | venue = | studio = | genre = [[Video game music|Video game soundtrack]] | length = | label = Ubisoft Music | producer = [[Winnie Waldron]] | prev_title = | prev_year = | next_title = | next_year = }} {{Album ratings | rev1 = ArtasticGaming.com | rev1Score = A+{{cite web|first=Jennifer |last=Bosier |title=Assassin's Creed 3: Liberation soundtrack review — Artastic Gaming |url=http://www.artasticgaming.com/assassins-creed-3-liberation-soundtrack-review/ |publisher=ArtasticGaming.com |accessdate=December 26, 2012 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130313152409/http://www.artasticgaming.com/assassins-creed-3-liberation-soundtrack-review/ |archivedate=March 13, 2013 }} | rev2 = GSoundtracks.com | rev2Score = {{Rating|4|4}}{{cite web |first=Oliver |last=Ittensohn |title=GSoundtracks — Review: Assassin's Creed — Liberation |url=http://www.gsoundtracks.com/reviews/assassinscreedlib.htm |publisher=GSoundtracks.com |accessdate=December 26, 2012}} | rev3 = MundoBSO.com | rev3Score = {{Rating|4|5}}{{cite web |first=Conrado |last=Xalabarder |title=MundoBSO — Banda sonora — Assassin's Creed III: Liberation |url=http://www.mundobso.com/es/verbandasonora.php?id=14340 |publisher=MundoBSO.com |accessdate=December 26, 2012}} | rev4 = FilmMusicMedia.com | rev4Score = {{Rating|3.5|4}}{{cite web |first=Christian |last=Loescher |title=Assassin's Creed III: Liberation by Winifred Phillips (Review) |url=http://www.filmmusicmedia.com/reviews/assassinscreediiiliberationbywinifredphillipsreview |publisher=FilmMusicMedia.com |accessdate=December 26, 2012 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150321113710/http://www.filmmusicmedia.com/reviews/assassinscreediiiliberationbywinifredphillipsreview |archive-date=March 21, 2015 |dead-url=yes |df=mdy-all }} }} The music in the game was composed by [[Winifred Phillips]] and produced by [[Winnie Waldron]]. The soundtrack album was released by Ubisoft Music on the same day as the release of the ''Assassin's Creed III: Liberation'' video game, October 30, 2012.{{cite web|url=http://winifredphillips.com/index.html |title=Winifred Phillips, Award-Winning Composer |publisher=winifredphillips.com |date= |accessdate=September 20, 2012}} Together with music producer Winnie Waldron, Winifred Phillips won several awards for her work on this project. For the music composition of the Assassin's Creed III Liberation video game, Phillips won a Global Music Award for musical excellence.{{cite web|url=http://www.thegma.net |title=Music Talent Competition — Global Music Awards |publisher=thegma.net |date= |accessdate=March 7, 2013}} Composer Winifred Phillips and music producer Winnie Waldron won a 2012 Hollywood Music in Media Award for the music score for ''Assassin's Creed III: Liberation.''{{cite web |url=http://www.hmmawards.org/?p=3059 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130113014637/http://www.hmmawards.org/?p=3059 |dead-url=yes |archive-date=January 13, 2013 |title=Music Awards — Hollywood Music in Media Awards |publisher=hmmawards.org |date= |accessdate=November 20, 2012 }} The main theme music of the Assassin's Creed III: Liberation video game won a G.A.N.G. Award from the Game Audio Network Guild in the category of "Best Original Vocal Song — Choral."'{{cite web|url=http://www.insidegamingdaily.com/2013/04/10/aciii-liberation-score-brings-home-another-award/ |title=ACIII Liberation Score Brings Home Another Award — Inside Gaming Daily Blog |publisher=InsideGamingDaily.com |date= |accessdate=April 14, 2013}} The music of ''Assassin's Creed III Liberation'' won a GameFocus Award for Best Music of 2012.{{cite web|url=http://translate.googleusercontent.com/translate_c?act=url&depth=1&hl=en&ie=UTF8&prev=_t&rurl=translate.google.com&sl=auto&tl=en&twu=1&u=http://www.game-focus.com/game-focus/dossiers/les-meilleurs-jeux-video-de-2012-selon-gf-par-categories-46083/page-2.php%3Fshowall%3D&usg=ALkJrhjxjhFeL7VPWEYZa-zFtfnUqR4u0Q |title=The best video games of 2012 in GF by categories — Special Reports |publisher=GameFocus.com |date= |accessdate=December 26, 2012}} The game's musical score also received nominations in several year-end award competitions, including the GameZone Awards,{{cite web|url=http://www.gamezone.com/editorials/gamezone-s-game-of-the-year-2012-nominations#day2/ |title=GameZone's Game of the Year 2012 Nominations |publisher=gamezone.com |date= |accessdate=December 26, 2012}} the Best of [[IGN]] Awards,{{cite web|url=http://www.ign.com/wikis/best-of-2012/Best_PS_Vita_Sound |title=Best PS Vita Sound — Best of 2012 - IGN |publisher=ign.com |date= |accessdate=December 5, 2012}} and the [[G4 (U.S. TV channel)|G4TV]] [[X-Play]] Best of 2012 Awards.{{cite web|url=http://www.g4tv.com/thefeed/blog/post/729580/x-plays-best-of-2012-awards-results-2012-game-of-the-year-and-more/ |title=X-Play's Best of 2012 Awards Results - 2012 Game of the Year and More! - G4tv.com |publisher=g4tv.com |date= |accessdate=December 5, 2012}} The music of ''Assassin's Creed III Liberation'' was very well received by both game and music critics. Robert Workman of GameZone wrote, "The music is superb,"{{cite web|url=http://www.gamedaily.com6.gamezone.com/products/assassin-s-creed-iii-liberation/reviews/review-assassin-s-creed-iii-liberation-is-a-satisfying-side-story-with-some-minor-hiccups |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130124053306/http://www.gamedaily.com6.gamezone.com/products/assassin-s-creed-iii-liberation/reviews/review-assassin-s-creed-iii-liberation-is-a-satisfying-side-story-with-some-minor-hiccups |dead-url=yes |archive-date=January 24, 2013 |title=Review: Assassin's Creed III: Liberation is a satisfying side story, with some minor hiccups |publisher=GameZone.com |date= |accessdate=December 26, 2012 }} and Evan Narcisse of [[Kotaku]] called the soundtrack, "a stealthy success."{{cite web|url=http://kotaku.com/5960996/the-assassins-creed-iii-liberation-soundtrack-is-a-stealthy-success |title=The Assassin's Creed III: Liberation Soundtrack is a Stealthy Success |publisher=Kotaku.com |date= |accessdate=December 26, 2012}} Jen Bosier of VideoGameWriters said that the music of ''Assassin's Creed III Liberation'' was "without question, the best soundtrack the series has seen to date."{{cite web|url=http://videogamewriters.com/assassins-creed-3-liberation-review-56913 |title=Assassin's Creed 3: Liberation review |publisher=videogamewriters.com |date= |accessdate=December 26, 2012}} Music critic Randall Larson of BuySoundtrax.com stated, "This is a fine score and one that even non-gamers should applaud for its cinematic, dynamic and immersive drive." Reviewer Lucas Smith of Piki Geek asserted that "the soundtrack will go down as one of the year's best."{{cite web|url=http://pikigeek.com/2012/10/31/review-assassins-creed-3-liberations-soundtrack/ |title=Review: Assassin's Creed 3: Liberation's Soundtrack |publisher=PikiGeek.com |date= |accessdate=December 26, 2012}} {{Track listing | collapsed = yes | headline = ''Assassin's Creed III Liberation'' video game soundtrack | title1 = Liberation Main Theme | length1 = 2:01 | title2 = Stealth | length2 = 2:11 | title3 = Virtual Pursuit | length3 = 2:12 | title4 = The Docks | length4 = 2:02 | title5 = Abstergo Ops | length5 = 3:43 | title6 = Secrets of the Bayou | length6 = 2:02 | title7 = Poverty | length7 = 2:10 | title8 = Aveline's Escape | length8 = 3:36 | title9 = Society Suite in 4 Movements | length9 = 7:16 | title10 = Ride to Oblivion | length10 = 2:12 | title11 = Mayan Labyrinth | length11 = 2:04 | title12 = Chasing Freedom | length12 = 2:19 | title13 = The Hunt | length13 = 2:13 | title14 = Bayou Fortress | length14 = 2:00 | title15 = Safe Harbor | length15 = 2:07 | title16 = Shanty Town | length16 = 2:01 | title17 = Deliverance | length17 = 2:27 | title18 = Winter in the North | length18 = 2:04 | title19 = The Cathedral Grounds | length19 = 2:05 | title20 = Animus | length20 = 2:27 | title21 = In the Bayou | length21 = 2:23 | title22 = Mayan Ruins | length22 = 2:03 | title23 = River of the Mayans | length23 = 2:35 | title24 = Agate's Power | length24 = 3:26 | title25 = In the Service of Humanity | length25 = 3:11 | title26 = Virtual Reality Room | length26 = 3:26}} {{clear}} ==Reception== {{Video game reviews | GR = (Vita) 71.74%{{cite web|url=http://www.gamerankings.com/vita/640108-assassins-creed-iii-liberation/index.html|title=Assassin's Creed III: Liberation for PlayStation Vita|work=[[GameRankings]]|accessdate=April 27, 2014}}
(PC) 65.60%{{cite web|url=http://www.gamerankings.com/pc/730737-assassins-creed-liberation-hd/index.html|title=Assassin's Creed Liberation HD for PC|work=[[GameRankings]]|accessdate=April 27, 2014}}
(PS3) 61.94%{{cite web|url=http://www.gamerankings.com/ps3/730735-assassins-creed-liberation-hd/index.html|title=Assassin's Creed Liberation HD for PlayStation 3|work=[[GameRankings]]|accessdate=April 27, 2014}}
(X360) 61.50%{{cite web|url=http://www.gamerankings.com/xbox360/730736-assassins-creed-liberation-hd/index.html|title=Assassin's Creed Liberation HD for Xbox 360|work=[[GameRankings]]|accessdate=April 27, 2014}} | MC = (Vita) 70/100{{cite web|url=http://www.metacritic.com/game/playstation-vita/assassins-creed-iii-liberation|title=Assassin's Creed III: Liberation for PlayStation Vita Reviews, Ratings, Credits and More|accessdate=October 30, 2012|publisher=[[Metacritic]]}}
(PC) 64/100{{cite web|url=http://www.metacritic.com/game/pc/assassins-creed-liberation-hd|title=Assassin's Creed Liberation for PC Reviews|accessdate=October 30, 2012|publisher=[[Metacritic]]}}
(PS3) 64/100{{cite web|url=http://www.metacritic.com/game/playstation-3/assassins-creed-liberation-hd|title=Assassin's Creed Liberation for PlayStation 3 Reviews|accessdate=October 30, 2012|publisher=[[Metacritic]]}}
(X360) 62/100{{cite web|url=http://www.metacritic.com/game/xbox-360/assassins-creed-liberation-hd|title=Assassin's Creed Liberation for Xbox 360 Reviews|accessdate=October 30, 2012|publisher=[[Metacritic]]}} | G4 = 3.5/5{{cite web|url=http://www.g4tv.com/games/psv/66196/assassins-creed-3-liberation/review/|title=Assassin's Creed 3: Liberation Review|publisher=[[G4 (U.S. TV channel)|G4]]|first=Jake|last=Gaskill|date=November 14, 2012|accessdate=November 14, 2012}} | GSpot = 6.5/10{{cite web|url=http://www.gamespot.com/assassins-creed-iii-liberation/reviews/assassins-creed-iii-liberation-review-6399285/?tag=Topslot;Assassin039sCreedIiiLiberationReview;Assassin039sCreedIii|title=Assassin's Creed III: Liberation Review|last=McInnis|first=Shaun|date=October 31, 2012|accessdate=October 31, 2012|publisher=[[GameSpot]]}} | IGN = 7.2/10{{cite web | url = http://www.ign.com/articles/2012/10/30/assassins-creed-iii-liberation-review | title = Assassin's Creed III: Liberation Review | accessdate = October 30, 2012 | publisher = IGN }} | GI = 7.75/10{{cite web|url=http://www.gameinformer.com/games/assassins_creed_iii_liberation/b/playstation_vita/archive/2012/10/30/assassins-creed-iii-liberation-review.aspx|title=Assassin's Creed III Liberation The Brotherhood Finds A Home On Handheld|last=Juba|first=Joe|date=October 30, 2012|accessdate=October 30, 2012}} }} Initial reviews for ''Assassin's Creed III: Liberation'' were mixed to positive. [[Metacritic]], which assigns a score based on reviews from industry leaders, has the game scored at 70/100 based on 64 reviews, indicating "mixed or average reviews". Shaun McInnis, reviewer for [[GameSpot]], gave the game a score of 6.5/10, praising the protagonist as "...a woman born from the romance between a wealthy father and a slave mother, someone who has overcome her uncertain upbringing to find a new life in the Assassin Brotherhood". McInnis also commended the setting, writing "...a brilliant version of 18th-century New Orleans, one that beautifully reflects the diverse cultural ambience formed over years of operating as a French trading port". However, he also wrote that the game "squanders its most unique ideas...Liberation takes little advantage of its own narrative format" and that the plot is "largely aimless and hastily delivered". [[IGN]]'s Greg Miller stated, "The moves and kills you'd expect are here, but the story is boiled down to be easy to jump in and out of. That takes away some of the excitement in playing through it", giving it 7.2/10. In December 2015, ''[[Game Informer]]'' ranked the game as the 10th best game in the ''Assassin's Creed'' series to date.{{cite web|url=http://www.gameinformer.com/b/features/archive/2015/12/04/ranking-the-entire-assassin-s-creed-series.aspx|title=Ranking The Entire Assassin's Creed Series|last=Juba|first=Joe|work=Game Informer|publisher=GameStop|date=December 4, 2015|accessdate=December 5, 2015}} {{clear}} ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} ==External links== *[http://assassinscreed.ubi.com/en-us/games/assassins-creed-3-liberation.aspx ''Assassin's Creed III: Liberation''] at Ubi.com *[http://assassinscreed.ubi.com/en-US/games/assassins-creed-liberation-HD.aspx ''Assassin's Creed: Liberation HD''] at Ubi.com {{portal bar|Video games|2010s}} {{Assassin's Creed}} [[Category:2012 video games]] [[Category:Assassin's Creed]] [[Category:Open world video games]] [[Category:PlayStation 3 games]] [[Category:PlayStation Network games]] [[Category:PlayStation Vita games]] [[Category:Ubisoft games]] [[Category:Video game remakes]] [[Category:Video games developed in Bulgaria]] [[Category:Video games developed in Italy]] [[Category:Video games featuring female antagonists]] [[Category:Video games featuring female protagonists]] [[Category:Video games scored by Winifred Phillips]] [[Category:Video games set in Mexico]] [[Category:Video games set in New Orleans]] [[Category:Video games set in the 18th century]] [[Category:Windows games]] [[Category:Xbox 360 games]] [[Category:Xbox 360 Live Arcade games]] [[Category:Video games about slavery]] [[Category:Multiplayer and single-player video games]]

After the station returned to Earth, Cable rebuilt it and renamed it [[Providence (comics)]] *[[Avalon (DC Comics)]], a fictional planet in the 30th century of the DC Universe *Avalon, the surname of four ''[[Cardcaptors]]'' characters (the American-version of ''Cardcaptor Sakura''): **[[Sakura Kinomoto|Sakura Avalon]] **[[Toya Kinomoto|Tori Avalon]] **[[Fujitaka Kinomoto|Aiden Avalon]] **[[Nadeshiko Kinomoto|Natasha Avalon]] *Captain Avalon, an alias used briefly by [[Captain (comics)|The Captain]] *[[Avalon Studios (comics company)]] was a subsidiary of [[Image Comics]] founded by [[Whilce Portacio]] and [[Brian Haberlin]] in the 1990s
